Dear Ayris Gonzalez:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
September 6, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records
(1) An instituation shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of the following information prior
to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions,
the institution shall complete a written
evaluation of the convictions that addresses
the nature of the conviction, the length of time
since the conviction, and the relationship of
the conviction to regulated activity for the
purpose of determining suitability for
employment in the institution.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
One related to the 2023 Renewal audit and one related to SIR #2024SIC0001515.
The violations for the 2023 Renewal audit were handled accordingly:
• Rules 113(1)(f)(ii) and 113(1)(i): The facility created a "new hire process"
form and policy to ensure a review of the candidate's file was being
completed prior to hire. This process was successful as there were no
violations for these rules in the current audit.
3

• Rule 127(4): The facility switched over to an online reporting system for
documenting observation checks as well as having the supervisor
complete random video reviews to ensure observation checks were being
completed as required. This process was successful as there were no
violations for these rules in the current audit.
• Rules 155(1), 156(5), and 167(4): The facility trained case managers on
the policy, hired a new case management supervisor, and had regular
due date reminders completed provided to the case managers via email.
In addition, the Assistant Program Director has been overseeing the case
management side, which has helped with follow-up and compliance.
These processes were successful as there were no violations for these
rules in the current audit.
The rule violation for SIR #2024SIC0001515 dated 7/30/24 was regarding Rule
118. The facility addressed the concern by completing a variance after the
violation was found. The variance was approved on 7/9/24. In addition, the job
description was updated to reflect the correct position requirements, and
checklists were created for new hires/transfers to ensure staff meet the
requirements of their positions prior to hire. Chief Administrator is also holding
quarterly CAP compliance meetings to monitor.
Financial Overview
The facility's annual budget and financial audit were reviewed with no concerns
noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) reported the violations from the 2023 Renewal audit were
discussed and trained with program leadership as well as new hires. The facility
has implemented new processes where the program shares State licensing
findings with applicable team members and reviews them during quarterly case
compliance meetings with the CA. CA notes this has helped with ensuring they are
all aware of the required action steps and are proactive in avoiding repeat
violations. CA noted updating new hire and transferred staff checklists were very
beneficial to ensure personnel record requirements were met. CA reported she
continues to have bi-weekly group supervision with program leadership to review
CCI compliance, which has improved oversight and communication.
4

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported they enjoy working at the facility. They feel the new home supervisor
has been an excellent addition, is very supportive, has open communication, and is
doing a great job. New staff reported orientation and shadow shifts were very
helpful in learning their roles. The Assistant Program Director reported they've
really been working on improving the case management process regarding
discharge reports, report timeliness, signatures, and case files.
Youth reported no concerns. They feel safe at the facility, feel they have staff they
can speak to if they have a need/concern, get enough food, and feel staff treat
them well.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility occurred on 9/6/24 and there were no concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
